reviews.review: Das Spiel ist einfach so Kreativ und Nice! Für den Preis lohnt sich das 111%!

На первый взгляд концепция этой игры до нельзя проста и может даже примитивна. Есть возможность создать одновременно два портала, на определенных поверхностях и через них проходить. Ну и еще крутым физоном все это приправлено. Но как говорится все идеальное просто. Это относится и к первой части Portal и к серии Half life. Та тоже не изобиловала разнообразием механик, однако то, как разработчики умело играют с имеющимися, заставляло играть не отрываясь, а по окончанию хотеть еще. Так же и здесь. На такой казалось бы простой концепции, по ходу игры создается огромное количество сложных и интересных головоломок. При том баланс сложности этих головоломок выверен идеально. Конечно хватает моментов когда приходится за стопориться на некоторое время и потупить, но такого, чтобы захотелось забросить игру, нет. Работает еще потому, что сложность нарастает очень плавно, в геометрической прогрессии, а потому за частую многое понимаешь интуитивно, но напрячь голову все ровно приходится. Все это дополняется грамотно поставленными локациями, которые в этой части обзавелись большим разнообразием. 
Хочется еще отметить отменный юмор и качественную русскую локализацию, что не маловажно. Ну и конечно же графон и физика для своего времени были превосходны. В общем, наверное даже если вы не любите головоломки в играх, то эта игра вполне способна ее привить, а потому рекомендовать можно всем, без исключений.

This game is a piece of art. It's way better than Portal 1. The graphics are good, the music and ambient is fantastic and the plot is genious. The puzzles are harder than in the first part but it's funnier to do them. I very like Wheatley, he has something that make him trusted by the players. Valve did a great job creating this game but they should make another part of this game.
Portal 2 did everything the first game did except better. More characters, more variables for puzzles, a more engaging story, and epic sound design and environmental storytelling.

I waited until 2020 to play both Portal games. If you're a fool like me, stop doing that, and buy this damn thing. Don't let the bean counters upstairs discourage you.
Really good and fun, although I haven't tested the co-op version, I can't imagine how that would feel.
Great game.  Excellent story, as well as gameplay that changes as the story goes on.  Fingers crossed for a sequel eventually.

Portal 2 is a amazing game witch finishes off the portal series perfectly, every few chapters the puzzle change in what variables are mainly used and the co-op is the ulitmate mode to experience portal while getting frustrated with your friends.

I'm sorry, I've owned this game for years, played it with my sister & friends, and have not written a review on it? Blasphemous.

Portal & Portal 2 are puzzle shooters, with a story that is more prominent in the latter game, though it follows what the environment and sly dialogue explained for us in the original first installment. Personally I think the graphics of this game still work today, though it is obvious that it has aged, yet like fine wine, it can only get finer.

The puzzles, once you've solved them, are most likely carved into your head for any future playthrough of the game, reducing the total time needed to finish the game by... a lot. The replayability comes in the form of achievements for some, but for a lot, it has to be the community maps acquired from the steam workshop, and the co-op included. Portal 2 already offers an entertaining, full of VALVe humour story & dialogue, but thanks to the steam workshop, players can make their own maps, for friends, or for everyone to play. 

These community maps aren't even exclusively co-op, there are single player oriented puzzlers out there of various difficulties for everyone to enjoy.

--

On the flip side of the coin, yes it is an aging game, and there's a different kind of thinking required versus big titles like Borderlands, or Dark Souls...Warframe, no hacking nor slashing. As it is a more story-driven game than the first, some find the puzzles lacking and too easy, though each to their own on that opinion, and some materials have certainly been re-used, for instance; the boss battle is practically a repeat of the original game.

If you're new to the Portal franchise by now, and do not like puzzles, it would be respected that you just look for something else, but know you miss out on a story that has been very well told. In its prime, Portal introduced new thinking that helped make the games currently on the market today, and the graphics weren't outdated, if anything, since some of us didn't know any better, those wall tiles made for the cleanest rooms we've seen in a game.
it has really good storyline and graphics. Must-Play if you like sci-fi and robots (when they turn against you)
